meanings.definition: A projecting corner or angle of a wall.
meanings.sent1: The spider built its web in the coignes of the old brick wall.
meanings.sent2: The painter carefully painted the coignes of the house to make them stand out.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hid its acorns in the coignes, thinking they were safe from other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were hidden in the coignes of her mind, waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight cast a shadow in the coignes, creating a beautiful pattern on the wall.

meanings.definition: A wedge-shaped stone at the corner of a building.
meanings.sent1: The ancient castle was adorned with intricate coignes at every corner.
meanings.sent2: The mason carefully placed the coignes to ensure the stability of the structure.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the coignes were magical stones protecting the castle from dragons.
meanings.sent4: His words were like coignes, sharp and cutting through the silence of the room.
meanings.sent5: The coignes of the building were weathered by time, yet they stood strong against the elements.

meanings.definition: To secure or strengthen with a coign.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter coignes the wooden beams together to make the structure more stable.
meanings.sent2: She coignes the fragile vase to prevent it from falling off the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The magician coignes the cards together before performing his tricks.
meanings.sent4: His words coignes their friendship, binding them closer than ever before.
meanings.sent5: The love between them coignes their hearts, making them inseparable.
